text: today I'm going to show you how to make
a Taiwanese homestyle dish that my
grandmother used to make for me all the
time when I was younger
it's Taiwanese style steamed ground pork
with pickled melons now in Taiwanese we
call this dish guava now guava is not
terribly difficult to make it's actually
very simple but it's one of those dishes
that's so flavorful and delicious served
over a bowl of hot rice that I can never
get enough of it so with that let's get
started on the ingredients for the
ingredients we'll need half a pound of
ground pork two cloves of garlic one
whole egg a quarter cups of pickled
melons now these are basically Asian
cucumbers that have been marinated in a
sweet and savory sauce and you can
usually find this at your local Asian
grocery store we'll also need two to
three tablespoons of the liquid from
this jar
in addition to this you'll also need one
tablespoon of water two to three stalks
of green onions and a quarter cup of
chopped yellow onions start by finely
chopping the pickled melons green onions
and yellow onions next add that into a
bowl with the ground pork the minced
garlic the pickled melon juice water and
one egg white setting aside and
reserving the egg yolk for later mix all
the ingredients really well I recommend
using your hands then transfer the
mixture to a bowl for steaming
now it's time to cook steamed the pork
for 25 to 30 minutes or until the juices
run clear the total cook time really
depends on the size of the bowl and the
thickness of the pork when it's done
press down gently in the center with the
spoon then carefully place the egg yolk
on top continue steaming for a few
minutes until the egg is cooked to your
liking I usually recommend anywhere from
1 to 3 minutes when you're done garnish
the top with some green onions and serve
hot with a bowl of freshly cooked rice
so that's how you make my grandma's
steamed pork with pickled mellows recipe
it was very easy to Steve him put
together so if you love Taiwanese food I
really hope you have the chance to try
making this at home I'm angel I hope you
guys enjoyed this video don't forget to
Like and subscribe to my channel for
more authentic Asian recipes made simple
and fun I'll see you guys soon bye mmm
grandma's recipes are the best
